instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime
threads.message:
Hello,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, with no liquid damages, that has no chime. It powers on, but doesn't do anything. Just shows a black screen. Connected to the power supply, it consumes about 750mA.

Can anyone help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime
threads.message:
The chime is not a relevant test.
Did you test USB activity?
Do you get voltage on all coils, including VCORE?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime
threads.message:
Hello 2informaticos,
I have no activity in USB.
L9701 has 0V; L3895 has 2.5V on both pins; L7760 has 1.75V on both pins; L7520 has 0.9V on both pins. L7510 has 0.5V on pin 1 and 0.9V on pin2; L7550 has 0V on both pins.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime
threads.message:
Do you get 0.9V on VCORE from the beginning, or you note a drop from 1.15V?

BTW, measure coil voltages on the output pin only...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime
threads.message: On both coils i have 0.9V from the begining

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime
threads.message:
Then board doesn't boot.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?
Try known good BIOS file.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no chime
